alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Franklin and western Hart Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 509 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Carnesville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carnesville, Royston, Lavonia, Canon, Franklin Springs, Bowersville, Victoria Bryant State Park, Gumlog and Vanna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
